Bicycle: If all public transport stopped working, one of the most effective ways to travel long distances without a car would be to use a bicycle. You can also plan your route carefully and stop at various points along the way to rest and explore the surroundings.

Walk: Another option is to walk long distances. This is a great way to stay fit and healthy while traveling. You can plan your route carefully and stop at various points along the way to rest and explore the surroundings. Walking is also a great way to see the sights and get some fresh air.

Hitchhike: Hitchhiking is another option for long-distance travel without a car. This is a great way to meet new people and see different parts of the country. You can also use hitchhiking as a way to travel to different cities and explore the surroundings.

Carpool: If you have friends or family members who are traveling to the same destination, you can carpool. This is a great way to save money on gas and travel together. You can also plan your route carefully and stop at various points along the way to rest and explore the surroundings.

Train: If you have access to a train station, you can use the train to travel long distances. Trains are often more comfortable and spacious than cars, and they can be a great way to relax while traveling.
